intro: Aklema oaxacana, commonly known as the Oaxaca lily, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Oaxaca, Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and has a rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. It blooms in the spring and is adapted to the cool, humid climates of its native habitat. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it remains relatively rare in cultivation.
